events.name: EV battery supply chain configurations
events.wd_description: Analysis of different configurations in the EV battery supply chain reveals various cost and logistical implications.
events.description: Analysis of different configurations in the EV battery supply chain reveals various cost and logistical implications.

events.name: Scenario A
events.wd_description: Scenario A has the highest unit cost due to the Advanced Warehouse being 20 km away from the plant, requiring dedicated trips.
events.description: Scenario A has the highest unit cost due to the Advanced Warehouse being 20 km away from the plant, requiring dedicated trips.

events.name: Scenario B
events.wd_description: Scenario B is cheaper than Scenario A as the Advanced Warehouse is inside the production site, but space constraints require plant layout redesign.
events.description: Scenario B is cheaper than Scenario A as the Advanced Warehouse is inside the production site, but space constraints require plant layout redesign.

events.name: Scenario C
events.wd_description: Scenario C is more expensive than Scenario B but cheaper than Scenario A, with batteries directly sent to the production line from the Advanced Warehouse located 20 km away.
events.description: Scenario C is more expensive than Scenario B but cheaper than Scenario A, with batteries directly sent to the production line from the Advanced Warehouse located 20 km away.

events.name: Scenario D
events.wd_description: Scenario D is the cheapest configuration with a direct connection between the supplier plant and the production line but is the most risky due to the 2,000 km distance.
events.description: Scenario D is the cheapest configuration with a direct connection between the supplier plant and the production line but is the most risky due to the 2,000 km distance.
